title.value: Вынос основных элементов питания яровой тритикале и сорными растениями в органогенезе
Removal of basic nutrients by spring triticale and weed plants in organogenesis

journal.title: Soil Science and Agrochemistry : scientific journal

person.name: Soroka, S.V., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute of Plant Protection

abstract.value: In course of the research there was studied the removal of basic nutrients (N, P2O5, K2O, CaO, MgO) by spring triticale (Triticosecale) and the dominant class of weed plants and assessed its influence on crop yield. The research was realized in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus in Minsk region on the experimental field of the Institute of Plant Protection in 2011. As a result of realized research it was revealed that during the vegetation period at various stages of crop development the amount of nitrogen removed by weed plants made 2.7-14.8 kg/ha, phosphorus – 2.2-20.1 kg/ha, potassium – 6.7-39.0 kg/ha, calcium – 1.7-4.5 kg/ha, magnesium – 0.9-3.1 kg/ha. A dependence of nutrients removal on weed plant species and vegetative mass was revealed. Especially strongly nutrients were absorbed by weeds, forming a well-developed vegetative mass. In crops of spring triticale the biggest removal of nutrients accounted for lamb's-quarters (Chenopodium album) and tripleurospermum perforatum. As the growth of weeds the increase of their vegetative growth and removal as a consequence of their increased mineral nutrients was occurred, which led to lower of yields.
